text: Ken Nelson (born May 22, 1936) is a retired clergyman, politician, and veteran from Minnesota. He served in the Minnesota House of Representatives. ==Early life and career== He was born in Grant County, Minnesota. He served with the United States Army in France from 1954 to 1956. ==Political career== He represented District 59B to the state House from 1973 to 1982 and District 62A from 1983 to 1992. ==Personal life== When elected, he was a member of Mount Olivet Lutheran Church and lived in Minneapolis. After being elected he married Susan, and had three children. ==References== Category:Members of the Minnesota House of Representatives Category:1936 births Category:Living people
title: Ken G. Nelson
